questions.text: What was the first prime-time animated series?
questions.explanation: The Flintstones premiered in 1960 on ABC.

questions.text: Who is Yogi Bear's constant companion?
questions.explanation: Boo-Boo Bear is Yogi's smaller, voice-of-reason sidekick.

questions.text: Which show featured a boy adventurer, his dad, and 'Race' Bannon?
questions.explanation: Jonny Quest was known for its realistic art style and action-adventure tone.

questions.text: What is the name of The Jetsons' dog?
Which character constantly tried to catch the Road Runner?
questions.explanation: Super Genius Wile E. Coyote used many ACME products in his failed attempts.

questions.text: Top Cat was the leader of a gang of cats living where?
questions.explanation: Top Cat (T.C.) lived in a trash can in Hoagy's Alley.
The pink mountain lion Snagglepuss used this catchphrase (and 'Exit, stage left').
The humble Shoeshine Boy would transform into Underdog.

questions.text: Which show featured a superhero ghost?
questions.explanation: Space Ghost fought villains in outer space.

questions.text: Bullwinkle J. Moose's best friend was:
questions.explanation: Rocky and Bullwinkle were the stars of the show.
The theme song warns: 'Watch out for that tree!'
Fleegle, Bingo, Drooper, and Snorky were live-action performers in suits.
The Mach 5 had special buttons for jacks, saws, and underwater mode.
'Scooby-Doo, Where Are You!' premiered in September 1969.

questions.text: Which superhero cartoon had the theme song: 'Does whatever a spider can'?
questions.explanation: The 1967 Spider-Man cartoon theme is iconic.
